quotes.quote: Human language is lit with animal life: we play cats-cradle or have hare-brained ideas; we speak of badgering; or outfoxing someone; to squirrel something away and to ferret it out.
Your library is your paradise.
There is a kind of serenity in love which is almost a paradise.
Paradise is exactly like where you are right now... only much, much better.
Paradise was made for tender hearts; hell, for loveless hearts.
The only paradise is paradise lost.
Those who promise us paradise on earth never produced anything but a hell.
A fool's paradise is a wise man's hell!
Time has shown that Paradise is not cheap, and neither is Hell unnecessary.
Recollection is the only paradise from which we cannot be turned out.
Children are the keys of paradise.
Oxford, the paradise of dead philosophies.
God comes first. Paradise is not cheap.
Hell is where everyone is doing his own thing. Paradise is where everyone is doing God's thing.
We must prefer real hell to an imaginary paradise.
He who indulges in falsehood will find the paths of paradise shut to him.
Every beloved object is the center point of a paradise.
A worker's paradise is a consumer's hell.
Paradise is too perfect for humanity.
The heart of man is, so to speak, the paradise of God.
The path to paradise begins in hell.
Even paradise could become a prison if one had enough time to take notice of the walls.
God hides the fires of hell within paradise.
Certainly paradise, whatever, wherever it be, contains flaws. If it did not, it would be incapable of drawing the hearts of men or angels.
Whoever threads a path seeking knowledge, Allah will make easy for him the path to paradise.
Paradise is open to all kind hearts.
He who aspires to paradise should learn to deal with people with kindness.
Privacy is paradise.
